channel.title: Design Team on Nancy's Creative Mess
channel.description: Recent content in Design Team on Nancy's Creative Mess

item.title: *Less Is More #475*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge at Less is More… we are playing with a one layer card which means we want ONLY ink on paper… no added die cuts, no layers. The twist for this challenge is to draw your own frame. Please share your creations with us HERE! I shared my first creation for this challenge a few days ago… but then realized that I couldn’t use the die cut butterfly.

item.title: *Time Out Challenges #224*
item.description: October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month and the team at Time Out had originally had our challenge today as a Breast Cancer challenge… as a colon cancer survivor (x2), I respectfully asked if we could change it to a cancer awareness challenge… everyone knows about and talks about breast cancer, but no one talks about colon cancer (and many other cancers). It’s SO important to me that we talk about all forms of cancer, that we not be embarrassed about talking about our health, our bodies and the changes we are experiencing.

item.title: *Build Your Stash Holiday Cardmakers*
item.description: I am very excited to announce that I have joined the design team at the Build Your Stash Holiday Cardmakers blog!! This is an awesome sketch challenge blog that has a new sketch each month, encouraging you to create Christmas cards each month. I will be sharing two cards each month with the monthly sketch. I hope you’ll check them out and join in the fun! This is the sketch for October… I LOVE that they include measurements!

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #490*
item.description: Hello again, crafty friends! It’s time for a new colour challenge at CAS Colours and Sketches. I can’t wait to see how you all create with the colours below! I’ve said it before… I struggled with these three colours. This was a new level of struggle for me. If I wasn’t on the design team, I probably would have passed it up. I just could not do anything that I liked with these colours.

item.title: *CASology #408*
item.description: It is with some sadness that I am here with the final challenge at CASology... after many years of wonderful clean and simple challenges, Melissa has decided it is time to retire the CASology Challenge. I think it would be an awesome send off to have a lot of cards submitted for this final challenge… an awesome tribute to a great challenge and to a great team of inspiring CAS creators.

item.title: *AAACards #225*
item.description: It’s a 1 of 9 rectangles challenge at AAACards with the optional twist of gnomes… We’d love to see your cards where you use only one of the 9 rectangles found if you divide a rectangular card in 9ths. Be sure to keep it clean and simple and share it with us HERE! You KNEW I’d have to use the optional twist! I used a non-Christmas gnome stamp set but added a tiny holiday wish to it to make it a Christmas card.

item.title: *Addicted to CAS #230*
item.description: There’s a new challenge at Addicted to CAS that starts today. The code word is Autumn. Play along with us by sharing you clean and simple cards HERE! I had fun doing a little ink blending on a piece of cardstock and then stamping and cutting out these fun leaves. I don’t use a lot of brown in my cards but an autumn theme and these colours called for some brown.

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #489*
item.description: I absolutely love the sketch this week at CAS Colours & Sketches! My card went together pretty quickly once I decided on what elements I wanted to use. I hope you’ll play along with us! My card uses a few pieces from my bin of extras that I kept overlooking. I had used just two of the layering stencils and these two pieces had very little colour on them… so I grabbed my Copics and gave them a bit more colour before adding them to my card.

item.title: *Less is More #474*
item.description: October 1st is World Cardmaking Day and here at Less is More, we are celebrating a little early with a friendship themed challenge! We think making a card for a friend is a great way to celebrate World Cardmaking Day! We hope you’ll play along! I’ve got a couple of very good friends who are always there for me… to listen, to provide support, to make me laugh, to distract me, to do social things with… so I thought I’d make a card that I could give to one of them.

item.title: *Time Out #223*
item.description: There’s a new photo inspiration challenge at Time Out Challenges. Our sponsor for this challenge is Newton’s Nook and as always, we thank them for their generousity! This is such a lovely image to get inspiration from. I used the tree along the side of the photo along with some silver and grey for my inspiration Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Basic Black; Lawn Fawn Silver Holograpic *Images: Taylored Expressions Simple Strips Christmas

item.title: *AAACards #224*
*Addicted to CAS #229*
item.description: We’re back with another Addicted to CAS challenge… Just a quick post for me before I head off to work. I usually do my blogging on Wednesday mornings before work and I lost Wednesday morning to Urgent Care (see yesterdays post) so I am feeling more than a little behind! Card Info *Cardstock: Yupo *Images: Studio Katia Birthday Greetings *Ink: Versafine Clair Nocturne; Tim Holtz Alcohol Inks in Raspberry, Glacier, Alchemy (pearl)

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #487*
item.description: There’s a new sketch challenge at CAS Colours & Sketches. This is a great sketch to showcase a little bit of patterned paper or an embossed panel… or keep it just a solid colour. There are so many options! I saw this sketch and immediately wanted to use this beautiful Stampin' Up! paper from last year. It took a while for me to decide what to do with the other element on the card but I landed on the gnome and I like how it turned out!

item.title: *Less is More #473*
item.description: It’s a black and white clean and simple challenge this week at Less is More… I hope you’ll play along! I used a portion of a great Poppy Stamps frame die to create the focal point on my card. I’m not sure how I feel about the uneven white mat around my focal point… hmmmm Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Basic Black *Images: Taylored Expressions Simple Strips *Ink: Versafine Clair Nocturne

item.title: *TIme Out Challenges #222*
item.description: It’s time for a word prompt challenge at Time Out Challenges. We have a $25 gift card to Lawn Fawn up for grabs for one lucky player!! This is such a beautiful quote by Maya Angelou…. and it’s something I try to do when I’m at work. I work at the front desk of a chiropractic clinic and we often see people who are in a lot of pain. I try had to be a bright spot in their day, maybe help them feel a little better for a few minutes while they have to interact with me.

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #486*
item.description: There’s a new host this month at CAS Colours & Sketches… Patricia has chosen these fun colours to play with this week! I hope you’ll play along! As you will often see me say, I struggled with these colours. I don’t often put yellow on a card and certainly not with these other colours! I wanted to play with ink for this challenge so I had to pull some similar colours from my stash and I added the Mango Melody in a layer.

item.title: *CASology #407*
item.description: It’s the first Tuesday of the month which means there is a new CASology challenge. Our cue for this month is HAPPY! The cue is easy for me as the majority of the cards I make are for birthdays… I pulled out some rainbow colours and an alphabet die set and created this for you! Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Basic Black, Poppy Parade, Daffodil Delight, Granny Apple Green, Pacific Point, Highland Heather

item.title: *AAACards #223*
item.description: It’s time for a no layer card challenge with AAACards… that’s right… just the card itself! The optional twist is to make it a sympathy card. Sympathy cards are not a card anyone wants to make… but they are necessary to have in our stash. I personally like to make my sympathy cards subdued… I was curious to see how the silver foil would look on grey cardstock so that’s what I played with for my challenge card.

item.title: *Addicted to CAS #228*
item.description: It’s time for a new clean and simple challenge at Addicted to CAS. This challenge was difficult for me…. because I don’t like birds! I have a few in my stash but they don’t really get used. But something different happened when the current Stampin’ Up! catalogue came out and I NEEDED these sweet bird stamps and the punch that goes with it! Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Granny Apple Green, Bermuda Bay, Pumpkin Pie

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #485*
item.description: It’s the 5th Tuesday of the month so we have a double challenge for you at CAS Colours & Sketches! We’ve taken some retired Stampin’ Up! colours and an old sketch and want to see you combine the two to create something beautiful! I had to move the sentiment on my card as it just didn’t feel right floating up there in the left corner like in the sketch. I even made a square card, which I don’t do very often!

item.title: *Less is More #472*
item.description: The new challenge at Less is More is to use vellum. There are so many different ways to use vellum in your creations and I can’t wait to see what you all come up with! I had a few ideas in my head about how I wanted to use vellum and I decided I wanted to try foiling on it to see if it would work. I’m here to report that it works pretty well, although there are some splotchy spots so I wouldn’t recommend doing anything that isn’t line art or sentiments.

item.title: *Time Out Challenges #221*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge at Time Out Challenges with a wonderful prize from Birch Press Designs to be won!! I hope you’ll play along, sharing your FESTIVE cards!! I know that Festive can refer to a lot of different things, but to me, festive is Christmas… so I made a Christmas Card using a product I bought at the end of the season last year and hadn’t yet played with.

item.title: *Christmas Craft Creations August*
item.description: There’s still time to play along with the latest challenge at Christmas Craft Creations! I sure hope you’ll play along! My winter activity is playing in the snow…. you can see I had fun building an igloo and decorating it! In reality, I had more fun playing with my Glimmer Hot Foil Machine to create my snowy background LOL! Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Smokey Slate *Images: Mama Elephant Merry Greetings; MFT Polar Penguins

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #484*
item.description: It’s time for another sketch challenge at CAS Colours and Sketches. You can rotate the sketch if you like, but we need to be able to see the essence of the sketch in your creation. And those rectangles? You can use any shape you want! My card was going to be one layer… until I messed up the place of my splats so I trimmed down a front panel and adhered it to a new card.

item.title: *AAACards #222*
item.description: It’s a moodboard challenge at AAACards… you can take inspiration from any portion of the moodboard and create a clean and simple card to share with us! I simply chose the health care part of the moodboard and made a get well card with a sweet puppy. Card Info *Images: Little Paper Shop Puppy Love; MFT Essential Sentiments *Ink: Versafine Clair Nocturne; Memento Tuxedo Black; Copics *Dies: MFT Stitched Rectangles

item.title: *Addicted to CAS #227*
item.description: There’s a new challenge at Addicted to CAS today… time to show us your clean and simple creations featuring the colour pink! I don’t know why but I struggled with this prompt…. but then I gabbed out some stencils and had a little play with them. I stencilled the pink swirls first and then put a second stencil on top of the first stencil and used Glimmer Paste so that the sparkly circles only showed up on the pink swirls.

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #483*
item.description: There’s a new colour challenge at CAS Colours & Sketches that starts today…. these colours are PERFECT to use on a black background if you like that sort of popping neon appearance. We always love to see what others do with our sketches and colour combinations so I hope you’ll play along and share your card with us! I absolutely LOVE how some colours just POP off of a black background.

item.title: *Less Is More #471*
item.description: There’s a new clean and simple challenge over at the Less is More blog…. we are looking to see your one layer cards (which means the one layer is your card base) with your favourite flower! Be sure to head over to the Less is More blog to see the beautiful creations by the rest of the design team and to share your creations with us. You knew this wouldn’t be a difficult challenge for me….

item.title: *Time Out Challenges #220*
item.description: I’m back as part of the design team at Time Out Challenges with a new challenge to get your creative juices flowing! This is one of two non-clean and simple blogs that I design for so let your creativity flow as much as you want with these challenges! For the next two weeks, we want to see you create your own backgrounds! We have an awesome prize from Stamplorations available to be won as well!

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #482*
item.description: It’s time for a new sketch challenge at CAS Colours & Sketches… I’m hosting this month so this is a sketch I came up with. As always, you can rotate or flip the sketch but you need to make sure that the essence of the sketch remains true… and remember to keep your card clean and simple! Be sure to head over to the CAS Colours & Sketches Blog to see how the rest of the design team interpreted the sketch and to share your creation with us!

item.title: *AAACards #221*
item.description: It’s time for the first clean and simple challenge of August with AAACards. Our challenge for the next two weeks is “small and few” which means you should use a few small images on your card… the optional twist is (lady)bugs. The design team has some wonderful inspiration on the blog. We hope to see you playing along with us! I love ladybugs and they are so easy to colour for someone like me who doesn’t find colouring zen-inducing.

item.title: *Addicted to CAS #226*
item.description: Happy Saturday crafty friends! It’s time for a new challenge with the team at Addicted to CAS! I hope you’ll head over to the blog to see what the design team has come up with for this challenge as there’s always some great inspiration by my team mates! And we’d love to see you play along with us too! As I recently had another challenge that was a tropical theme (where I did florals) I decided to turn my focus to a tropical drink instead.

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #481*
item.description: Happy Tuesday creative friends! It’s time for a new challenge with the team at CAS Colours & Sketches… and for the month of August, I am the host! We are staring off this month with a colour challenge. I can’t wait to see what everyone creates using these great colours! Be sure to check out the CAS Colours & Sketches blog to see what the rest of the design team created!

item.title: *CASology #406*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge at CASology and the cue for this month is SAND. I hope you’ll check out what the rest of the design team has created and maybe even share a creation of your own!! You’ll find the CASology blog HERE Despite loving the beach, I don’t have a lot of a things that are beach themed… so I had to think about how to create something with this cue.

item.title: *Less is More #470*
item.description: There’s a new clean and simple challenge at Simply Less is More…. our theme for this challenge is Butterflies! I hope you’ll play along with us and share your creations HERE! The design team has some beautiful butterfly cards for you to see… be sure to go to the blog to check them out! I cut some of those gorgeous little butterflies out of glitter paper to create my card…

item.title: *Time Out Challenges #219*
item.description: It’s time for a new photo inspiration challenge at Time Out Challenges. Every two weeks we have a challenge of a different type complete with prizes for our winners! For this week, Varada Sharma is offering us two $15 vouchers to give to our winners!! To win, simply share your creations inspired by the photo below! You can see all of the information and share them HERE. I was inspired by the sunset and the silhouette of the grasses on the shore for my card…

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #480*
item.description: There’s a new sketch challenge at CAS Colours & Sketches today…. remember you can rotate or flip this sketch if you want, as long as the essence of the sketch is seen in your card. Share your creations with us HERE as we love to see what everyone else comes up with! A friend asked for a bunch of thank you cards last week so I of course made her some!

item.title: *AAACards #220*
item.description: It’s time for a new clean and simple challenge at AAA Cards! We want to see your cards with the design only along the edge (you can choose which edge) with the optional twist of “in the sea”. This was tough for me because I had two design team obligations that were a similar theme back to back! And the themes aren’t something I find easy to do in the first place!

item.title: *Addicted to CAS #225*
item.description: The code word at Addicted to CAS is Nautical… I hope you’ll play along. The design team has created some fun ideas that you can see HERE. I had a bit in my stash that would have been ok for this challenge but nothing that was speaking to me… so I used some dies to create my nautical themed card instead. Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Sweet Sorbet, Starry Sky

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #479*
item.description: It’s time for a new colour challenge at CAS Colours & Sketches! Two of these colours are not my favourites… one of them I honestly only have two sheets of thanks to my friend Bonnie giving them to me! But I will admit… this is a great colour combination and I am pretty happy with how my card turned out! As I don’t have many Stampin’ Up! ink pads any more and I struggle with trying to find suitable matches with the inks I do have, most of my colour challenges will have cardstock as the colours instead.

item.title: *Less is More #469*
item.description: There’s a colour challenge at Simply Less is More… and that challenge is traditional Christmas. I hope you’ll dig out some of your Christmas stash and play along with us! To me, the traditional colours of Christmas are red, green and gold…. and I think “sparkle” should be a Christmas colour as well LOL! I just love sparkly things, especially for Christmas cards! Card Info *Cardstock: assorted glitter papers *Images: Simon Say Stamp Good Cheer

item.title: *Time Out Challenges #218*
item.description: It’s time for you to be inspired by words with the latest Time Out Challenge… you can see the quote in the graphic below. Our sponsor for this challenge is Newton’s Nook… if you share your card with us you’ll have a chance at winning a prize from them! I read this quote over and over and over again and the word that stood out to me each time was “dream”… so I made a “dreamy” card for you.

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #478*
item.description: Happy Tuesday my friends… and a BIG happy birthday to my big sister! It’s a milestone birthday for her today and I’m sad to not be celebrating it with her. It’s time for a new sketch challenge with CAS Colours & Sketches. Patricia came up with this fun sketch for us all to try this week! I really look forward to seeing what *you* create! I tried a few different things with this sketch and tossed them all in the bin… until I decided to turn the sketch and then I came up with something I liked on my first try.

item.title: *AAACards Challenge#219*
item.description: If it’s July, it must be Christmas in July season! AAACards has an anything CAS Christmas challenge for this week with the optional twist of pets. Pull your Christmas stash out of storage and play along with us HERE! You know I don’t enjoy colouring so I didn’t want to go out for my animal… so I chose this cute little birdie and coloured him up very simply. I love the mostly white card with just a hint of colour on the birdie.

item.title: *Addicted to CAS #224*
item.description: Happy Saturday!! It’s time for a new challenge with the team at Addicted to CAS! For the next two weeks we’d like you share how you interpret the code word of “kids”… be sure to go to the blog to see what the rest of the design team has done because there are some other fabulous cards! I went with a new baby card, partly because I needed a few in my stash!

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #477*
item.description: Patricia is our host for the month of July at CAS Colours & Sketches… she chose this wonderfully right colour palette for our first challenge this month. Being a part of this design team, I have discovered that I am much better at sketch challenges than I am with colour challenges. When I was only playing along, if the colours didn’t speak to me, I didn’t play. If the colours were at all challenging to me, I didn’t play.

item.title: *CASology #405*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge at CASology... our cue for you for July is WINDY. I have a funny wind story… last fall we put up some security cameras over our garage. Since the trees have leafed this year, we often get alerts from the cameras of “motion”… the other day we had hundreds of alerts in the morning when we work up… each one of them was the leaves on the trees thanks to the wind!

item.title: *Less is More #468*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge with Less is More…. our cue word for challenge #468 is “emboss”. You can use any interpretation of the word in your clean and simple card. I decided to go with an embossing folder for my card… and I grabbed the etched butterflies from my pile of extras from the card I shared a few days ago as I think they look embossed as well.

item.title: *Time Out Challenges #217*
item.description: Time Out Challenges is back with a great new challenge… this time we want you to be inspired by being kind! Our sponsor for this challenge is CAS-ual Friday stamps. I got these wonderful new dies from Paper Rose and couldn’t wait to play with them. I love how they look cut out of the gold foil cardstock! Card Info *Cardstock: gold mirror; Stampin’ Up! Basic Black *Images: Simon Says Stamp Big Thanks Words; Stampendous Big Words Thanks

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #476*
item.description: It’s time for the last sketch challenge for the month of June with CAS Colours & Sketches… our sketch this time is a slimline card and I went for a mini-slimline as I prefer that size. I took, a large floral stamp but only used a part of it so it would fit on my card. I even pulled out my Copics to do a little colouring (which isn’t easy as my wrist heals)

item.title: *AAACards #218*
item.description: It’s time for a new clean and simple challenge at AAA Cards! We have a sketch for you this week with the added optional twist of flowers. Of course I did both (because I love florals!) Share your card with us HERE for a chance to be chosen as a guest designer in an upcoming challenge! I always struggle with the placement of things like the sketch shows so I wanted to do something different.

item.title: *Addicted to CAS #223*
item.description: Good morning crafty friends… it’s time for a new challenge with Addicted to CAS! We are playing with the code word GRID for this challenge. I will admit that I struggled with this challenge. I had no idea how to interpret this word. But then I remembered I had some patterned papers that had a grid-look to them… and I went with the one that was more delicate looking to create my card for today.

item.title: *Christmas Craft Creations Trees*
item.description: There’s still some time to play along with the Christmas Craft Creations June theme of TREES! This is a great challenge to help you get a few Christmas cards made throughout the year. I had promised myself to make more Christmas cards before October and while I’ve done that, it’s really only been for this challenge! Maybe I should make one day a month where I make only Christmas cards.

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #475*
item.description: I am so happy that Samantha chose some of the new Stampin’ Up! In Color colours for our challenge at CAS Colours & Sketches this week. I just love the new colours and especially these three! I really hope you’ll play along with this colour combination this week! These colours are just so happy! They make me think of popsicles, and beach balls, and shovels and pails… all those wonderfully fun things in the summer!

item.title: *Less is More #467*
item.description: There’s a new one layer card challenge over at Simply Less is More… a one layer card means there are no other pieces of cardstock other than your card base. If you want to use dies, they have to be inlaid. For me, the best way to achieve a one layer card is some simple stamping. *you may add words as well* I had a thought in my head but had trouble getting all of the pieces together.

item.title: *Time Out Challenges #144*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge at Time Out Challenges… up for grabs this week is a $25 credit at Top Flight Stamps! Play along with us by sharing your card HERE. Our prompt for this challenge is “tropical”. I had some fun with the new Stampin’ Up! Colours and an old stamp and die set. Some of the leaves are stamped, some are cut out… I was able to create a little more dimension this way.

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #474*
item.description: It’s time for a new sketch at CAS Colours and Sketches… We hope you’ll play along with us this week by posting your creation HERE! I changed the sketch just a little bit, making the hexagon a little smaller. I just purchased these dies from Scrapbook.com and am so happy I did! I love the little hint of shiny gold on this card. Card Info *Cardstock: gold mirror *Images: Pink Fresh Studio Small Butterflies; Studio Katia Birthday Greetings

item.title: *AAACards #217*
item.description: Thanks for popping by today! I’m sharing with you, my card for the current clean and simple challenge at AAA Cards. We want you to use only 1 of the 9 rectangles on the front of your A2 card when you divide it up evenly (or 1/9 of any card size you like to use) with the optional twist of Butterflies. The 1/9th is the hard part for this card… I decided to use a little ink blending to create the rectangle to help me envision it… to create a little dimension, I used glue along the body of the butterfly and foam adhesive on the wings to make them pop up a bit

item.title: *Addicted to CAS #222*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge at Addicted to CAS… the code word for challenge #222 is DOTS! There are so many wonderfully fun ideas on the challenge blog by the design team… I hope you’ll go check them out. And then you need to create your own dotted masterpieces to share with us! I wanted to have some fun with the new Stampin’ Up! In Color colours for 2022-2024… so I used some old circle punches and cut out a bunch in three different colours.

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #473*
item.description: Samantha is the host for the month of June at CAS Colours & Sketches and she chose some great colours for our first challenge of the month! For our colour challenges, you must use all of the stated challenge colours. You may also use neutral colours; however, the challenge colours should be the most noticeable ones featured on your card. We use Stampin’ Up colour names for reference, but you are welcome to use any other companies’ products as long as you match the challenge colours as closely as possible.

item.title: *CASology #404*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge at CASology… I hope you’ll pop by the blog to see what the rest of the design team has done with the cue of RIDE. We love to see your clean and simple creations too… share them HERE! I almost skipped this challenge but then remembered this cute set from My Favorite Things and decided I’d give it a go. It’s not really my “style” but I’m glad I pushed myself a little.

item.title: *Less is More #466*
item.description: It’s time for a new clean and simple challenge at Less is More! We want to see your “masculine” themed cards for the next two weeks! Share them with us HERE!!! I always struggle with masculine cards. I don’t have much for masculine images and I tend towards purples and reds in my colour selections. I will admit, I almost skipped this challenge! I was poking around Pinterest and searched for “masculine colour combinations” and something similar to what I used popped up.

item.title: *Time Out Challenges #215*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge at Time Out Challenges… for challenge #215 we have a wonderful prize available to be won thanks to our generous sponsor, STAMPlorations. We really hope you’ll play along with us! For this challenge, we want you to be inspired by the photo in the card below. You can take anything from this inspiration photo and translate it on to your creation. I struggled with this photo… until I remembered that inspiration can come from anything in the photo.

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #472*
item.description: Welcome to the last challenge of the moth for CAS Colours & Sketches. As it is the fifth challenge this month, we have both a sketch and a colour combination for you to use! I will admit, I am not thrilled with my card. Maybe my border is too wide? It just feels like the Island Indigo overwhelms the rest of the card. The rest of the design team has inspiration for you HERE and I hope that you’ll play along with us!

item.title: *AAACards #216*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge at AAACards! AAA Cards is a clean and simple challenge blog that posts a new challenge every two weeks. We love to share our ideas on the cue cards and, more importantly, love to see what others come up with for our challenges! I sure hope you’ll play along and share your creations with us HERE! Let me explain our graphic a bit… for challenge #216, we want you to use the colours that you see in the graphic… and *optionally* we’d like to see a shaker card.

item.title: *Addicted to CAS #221*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenged with Addicted to CAS… for the next two weeks, we want to see you sharing your cards featuring stripes! I am the host for this challenge, which means this theme was my idea! Please share your clean and simple cards with strips with us HERE! I had a bit of trouble deciding on what I wanted to do for my card for this challenge… I have a lot of options when it comes to stripes.

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #471*
item.description: We’re back with another sketch with the team at CAS Colours and Sketches… We look forward to seeing what you create this week following the sketch below. Remember to keep your creations clean and simple! You can share your cards with us HERE! I will admit, this sketch had me scratching my head for a little bit. I just couldn’t figure out what I wanted to do. I was flipping through my bin of dies and saw the balloons and decided to see what I could come up with.

item.title: *Less is More #465*
item.description: It’s time for a colour challenge over at the Less is More blog. For this challenge we are playing with my favourite colour combination… RAINBOW! There is some wonderful inspiration to be seen created by the rest of the design team.. click HERE to check them out! I absolutely love creating with rainbows… they can be bright, muted, pastel, jewel toned… whatever you feel like! I received my new Stampin’ Up!

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #470*
item.description: It’s time for another challenge with CAS Colours and Sketches… and this week it’s a colour challenge. For our colour challenges, you must use all of the stated challenge colours. You may also use neutral colours; however, the challenge colours should be the most noticeable ones featured on your card. We use Stampin’ Up colour names for reference, but you are welcome to use any other companies’ products as long as you match the challenge colours as closely as possible.

item.title: AAACards #215*
item.description: I’ve got a quick clean and simple card to share with you today with the new challenge at AAACards. You have two weeks to play along with us HERE for your chance to be chosen as a guest designer for an upcoming challenge. I had another idea in my head for this card but I can’t hold a pen well enough to actually colour at the moment, so I had to scrap that idea and come up with something else.

item.title: *Addicted to CAS #220*
item.description: Challenge #220 at Addicted to CAS is all about flowers…. we can’t wait to see your beautiful flower creations! You get a bonus card from me today…. I created my alcohol ink background and fit two flower dies on it … and since they are so similar I decided to share them both in one post I really hope you’ll play along and share your cards HERE!

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #469*
item.description: Now that I have a little more mobility (and I do mean a little) with my right hand, I decided to try making a card on yesterday afternoon. Fine motor skills are still a bit of a struggle and I had to take a break part way through, but I managed to get a card done in time for the CAS Colours & Sketches challenge for this week. It’s a sketch challenge this week… I hope you’ll play along with us by sharing your clean and simple creations following the sketch below.

item.title: *Less is More #464*
item.description: Happy Saturday!! I hope that wherever you are right now that the sun is shining…I’m hoping that Mother Nature got the memo that it’s now May and hopefully the spring snow will be done for the year. It’s currently pretty lovely, but here in Calgary it can change without much notice! It’s time for a new clean and simple challenge at Less is More… for challenge #464 we want to see your clean and simple creations using a tag.

item.title: *Time Out #213*
*CASology #403*
item.description: Happy Tuesday creative friends… I saw my surgeon yesterday and as expected, the plaster splint was removed and I now have a removable brace. I can wear the brace when I’m up and about or if the arm/wrist is fatigued. I have some stretches thatI’ve started doing that are really tough but I am told it will all get easier… I am to use my arm and wrist as tolerated for anything non-weight bearing.

item.title: *Happy Birthday AAA Cards!*
item.description: AAACards is celebrating it’s 8th birthday!! We hope you’ll celebrate along with us by creating a clean and simple birthday card and sharing with us HERE. No birthday would be complete without presents so there are some prizes to be won as well! Head to the AAACards blog for all of the details! Someone posted about an easy interactive card idea that Jennifer McGuire did a video on… so I watched the video and decided to give it a try.

item.title: *Addicted to CAS #219*
*Christmas Craft Creations April 2022*
item.description: There’s still time to play along with the Christmas Craft Creations April challenge! We’d love to see your Christmas cards using plaid or tartan! When plaid first started being popular (again), I resisted it. I honestly wasn’t a big fan. But over the years it’s grown on me! There’s just something about a good old red and black buffalo check…. I had fun with some Stampin’ Up plaid papers and the L’il Gnome from Simon Says Stamp

item.title: *Less is More #463*
*Time Out #212*
item.description: Good morning friends…. the challenge at Time Out Challenges is spring! I love spring and how the world seems to come back to life. I chose butterflies as they will be gracing our gardens soon! I played with some white embossed Pink Fresh Studio butterflies and the awesome Birthday Brights rainbow paper from MFT on a slimline card.

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #466*
item.description: As I did have some cards created for the design teams I’m on before I broke my wrist last week, I figured I’d still blog them. Typing is slow with only one hand!v I am so sad to not be creating… I was on track to have a record breaking number of cards made. I haven’t gone fore more than 3 or 4 days without making cards in many weeks.

item.title: *AAACards #213*
item.description: It’s time for another clean and simple challenge with the team at AAACards. Our challenge for the next two weeks is “small and few” with the optional twist of Easter or Spring. I hope you’ll play along with us by sharing your clean and simple creations with us HERE! I did a quick and easy card thanks to this wonderful Lawn Fawn strip of flowers. I stamped them, coloured them quickly with a few spring colours of Copics, stamped my greeting and then put the flowers on the card with some foam adhesive.

item.title: *Addicted to CAS #218*
item.description: The team at Addicted to CAS is playing with just one layer for challenge #218. To me, a one layer card means there is no other cardstock on the card other than the card itself. You can add a few embellishments (pearls if you need to) but there shouldn’t be any layers or dies (unless you do an inlaid technique). It’s a difficult thing to do… and it’s hard to get depth and movement.

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #465*
item.description: Happy Tuesday crafty friends… the team at CAS Colours & Sketches is back with another sketch challenge to inspire you. We really hope you’ll play along and share your creations with us HERE! I stamped up a sheet of those wonderful Pink Fresh Studio butterflies and embossed them in white this time. I used a finger dauber to add colour to this butterfly after I’d cut it out, trying to keep colours in specific areas… it helped that I used similar colours.

item.title: *Less is More #462*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge with the team at Less is More. As you can see from the graphic below, the prompt is “occupations”. As always, we hope you’ll play along with our challenge and share your creations with us HERE! I struggled a bit with the challenge as I don’t really have any stamps that scream “occupations” to me… so I had to think outside the box a little.

item.title: *Time Out #211*
item.description: Happy Thursday crafty friends… the team at Time Out Challenges is back with a new photo inspiration challenge. We can’t wait to see what you create using the photo below as inspiration. Share your creations with us HERE for your chance to not only be chosen to play along as a Guest Designer in an upcoming challenge but to win a $15 credit to shop at our sponsor, Poppystamps! I used a layered diamond die cut pieces that I cut in half to create some blue and green and grey mountains.

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #464*
item.description: Bhavya is the host at CAS Colours & Sketches for the month of April. She has chosen a great ‘garden’ themed set of colours for us to use as her first colour challenge this month. I can’t wait to see how others interpret these colours! For our colour challenges, you must use all of the stated challenge colours. You may also use neutral colours; however, the challenge colours should be the most noticeable ones featured on your card.

item.title: *CASology #402*
item.description: I’m back with the design team at CASology for our April challenge. There are a lot of wonderful cards by the design team to see, so I hope you’ll head to the blog to see them! We’d love to see what you create as well! Share your creations with us HERE! When I saw the cue card for this challenge, my mind automatically went to animals…. but honestly, I’ve made a lot of cards with animals on them in the last little bit and I was a little tired of them.

item.title: *AAA Cards #212*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge with the team at AAA Cards… we are a clean and simple challenge blog with challenges every two weeks. For our current challenge, we want to see your clean and simple cards that are decorated “along the edge” with the optional twist of “your country”. Share your creations with us HERE for your chance to be chosen as a guest designer for an upcoming challenge!

item.title: *Addicted to CAS #217*
item.description: Happy Saturday crafty friends! I’m back with the team at Addicted to CAS with another clean and simple challenge for you all. We’d love to see your clean and simple cards featuring animals! Be sure to share your creations with us HERE for your chance to be chosen as a CAS Perfectionist!!! I have some animal stamps in my stash that have never seen ink (at least not by me!) so I decided to pull out one of those sets to play.

item.title: *Less is More Take 2*
item.description: As I mentioned a few days ago, I had made another card for the current Less is More challenge but I felt it wasn’t as “clean and simple” as I wanted… I still like the card so I’m sharing it with you now. Card Info *Images: Altenew Celebrate Toay *Ink: Versaamark; Copics *Etc: Stampin’ Up! gold embossing powder *Challenges: Less Is More #461

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #463*
item.description: It’s a Tuesday, so it’s time for a new challenge with CAS Colours and Sketches. As it is the fifth Tuesday of a month, our challenge is a double… Jeanne has chosen a past sketch and some retired colours to play with this week! Please make sure to have these three colours as the prominent colours of your clean and simple creation (but you can add neutrals as well). You are welcome to flip or rotate the sketch as long as the essence of the sketch remains.

item.title: *Less Is More #461*
item.description: Happy Saturday crafty friends! I usually work on Saturdays (my work week is Wednesday thru Saturday) but I get one Saturday off each month… this is that Saturday. I love my job, I really truly do… but I do look forward to my Saturdays off! It’s time for a new challenge with the team at Less Is More… our clean and simple challenge for the next two weeks is to use the colours pink and gold.
